meanings.definition: To pursue in order to catch or catch up with
meanings.sent1: The cat chases the mouse around the house.
meanings.sent2: The police officer chases the thief through the streets.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy chases its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: Time chases us all, never stopping for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The wind chases the leaves across the yard.

meanings.definition: To follow in order to overtake or capture
meanings.sent1: The cheetah chases the gazelle across the savannah.
meanings.sent2: The detective chases the suspect through the alleys.
meanings.sent3: The child chases after the ice cream truck, hoping for a treat.
meanings.sent4: The shadows chases the light as the sun sets.
meanings.sent5: The waves chases the shore, never giving up.

meanings.definition: To seek the favor or company of
meanings.sent1: The little girl chases her big brother around for attention.
meanings.sent2: The student chases the teacher after class to ask a question.
meanings.sent3: The cat chases its owner for a scratch behind the ears.
meanings.sent4: The fans chases the celebrity for an autograph.
meanings.sent5: The puppy chases its owner, eager for a walk.

meanings.definition: To drive or expel by force or threat of force
meanings.sent1: The scarecrow chases the birds away from the crops.
meanings.sent2: The security guard chases the intruders out of the building.
meanings.sent3: The loud noise chases the silence from the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm chases the picnickers indoors with its rain.
meanings.sent5: The barking dog chases the mail carrier down the street.
